Title: Release Stage
Description:
The solution release management process follows the below deployment approach:

  1. Development: Code changes are developed and committed to the repository.
  2. Build & Test: Azure DevOps Pipelines trigger automated builds and tests to validate code changes.
  3. UAT: Valid code is deployed to the UAT environment for business validation.
  4. Production: Business validated deployments are released to production.

Title: Code Commit
Description:
Developers will commit code changes to the source control repository (e.g., Azure Repos or GitHub).
The code must follow branching strategies to ensure that development, testing, and production environments remain stable.

  1. Configurations (customizations in MS nomenclature) are only done in the Customization Master (CM) environment and committed to the repository.
  2. DEV organization must be kept in sync with the CM organization (in terms of configuration and customization), preferably via script.
  3. Code is developed in Visual Studio and pushed to DEV via script and committed to the repository.
  4. After a commit (when a pull request is approved), the artifacts are built and published to DEV-INT if the unit tests and code quality metrics are green and additional automated tests (optional but recommended: Integration Tests, UI Automation Tests, Dataverse Health Check) are run in the target environment.
  5. Upon manual approval by the developer (to avoid that too many check-ins cause too many automated deployments disturbing the tests), the same artifacts are published to DEV-TEST where the iteration tests can be performed.
  6. At the end of the sprint (or earlier if previews are agreed with the functional stakeholders), the artifacts are published to UAT for demo and end user testing.
  7. After the final release demo and acceptance, a release branch can be optionally created which can be used to cherry-pick commits if hotfixes are required (otherwise, changes are constantly committed to the main branch so that no fixes are forgotten to be merged). Note that it is also possible to deploy to Prod from the main branch, this works for example well for stable projects which do quick releases or smaller engagement.
  8. The final artifacts are built and published to PROD.

Title: Continuous Integration
Description:
Azure DevOps Pipelines will automatically trigger a build pipeline when changes are committed.
The build pipeline will:
  • Compile code and dependencies.
  • Execute unit tests and ensure that code coverage meets Softcat's code coverage policy before being merged into target branches.
  • Generate artifacts (e.g., packages, configuration files) that will be used in the next stages.
  • Build failures will notify the development team to resolve issues before proceeding.

Title: Deploy to SIT Environments
Description:
After a successful build, the release pipeline will deploy the artifacts to the test environment.
The test environment will be used for integration testing and validating the D365/PROS system functionality.
Automated tests will be executed to validate system behaviours and integrations, including business rule checks, user interface validations, and performance assessments.

Title: Deploy to UAT Environments
Description:
Once the release passes testing in the test environment, it will be automatically deployed to the UAT environment using Azure DevOps Pipelines.

The UAT environment will closely resemble the production environment with realistic data, configurations, and integrations.

Title: Deploy to Production
Description:
Once UAT testing is successful, the release will be deployed to the production environment using Azure DevOps Pipelines.
The deployment process should be automated to reduce manual intervention and minimize human error.

Title: Manage Payment, Currency, Tax & Exchange Rates - Day 1
Description:
531 - Currency Management in Quotes:

1.The system should set the default currency on the quote to match the default currency of the admin region on the account, ensuring that only one currency is used per quote
2.The ability to select multiple buy currencies should be supported, but only one Sell currency should be allowed per quote.
3. The system should provide the ability to upload quotes in USD or other currencies and automatically convert them to the relevant currency for the individual. This conversion should help mitigate errors and prevent potential loss of GP caused by discrepancies in currency exchange
4. The system should provide the ability to send an email notification to Account Manager and Sales Support when the currency conversion rate has changed on the Quote
5. The system should provide the ability to compare different currencies within a quote and assess which currency would result in higher Gross Profit (GP) only within the aligned currencies for the admin region where the quote is built
6. The system should allow users to bulk upload products to a quote in different currencies. Users should have the ability to select the buy price currency for the products during the upload process.

537 - Currency Management in Quotes:
The system shall allow users to bulk upload products to a quote in different currencies. Users shall have the ability to select the buy price currency for the products during the upload process.

535 - Currency Management in Quotes:
The system shall provide the ability to send a notification to all involved in an opportunity (eg: Account Manager, Sales Support, specialist, MN specialist) when the currency conversion rate has changed on the Quote.

534 - Currency Management in Quotes:
The system shall allow users to select both the buy and sell currencies at the point of quote/order. The system will then automatically convert the selected currencies to the relevant currency for the individual based on the exchange rates stored in NetSuite, which are updated monthly

532 -Currency Management in Quotes:
The system shall automatically set the default sell currency on the quote to match the admin region's default currency for the account, ensuring that only one sell currency is used per quote. However, users will have the option to update the currency as needed.

337 - Exchange Rate Change Alert and FX Update for Open Quotes :
1.If the currency changes, the system shall automatically update the foreign exchange (FX) rates for any open quotes.
2.An alert shall be triggered to notify the account manager of the FX rate change.
3. The system should clearly display the difference in exchange rates, showing the original rate versus the current rate.
4. The system shall automatically flag quotes impacted by exchange rate changes.

684 - Multi Currency Tracking:
System should allow to capture and store both buying currency and selling currency for all Orders / Opportunities.

592 - Net GP Impact by Payment Term :
The system should display the net GP impact for different payment terms set by the user, at the time of quoting, with a marker at the account level. While GP calculations will be managed in NetSuite, D365 and PROS should pull this information and reflect it at the appropriate stages.

347 - For customers who require proforma invoice, the system will provide the ability to trigger a request to Netsuite to fetch proforma invoice with tax information and store a copy of the invoice.

591 - VAT /Tax Integration with NetSuite :
The system should integrate with NetSuite to fetch Tax and directly apply it to the quote to ensure accurate and consistent tax calculations.

538 - The system shall provide the ability to track and display the history of exchange rate changes within a quote, including the following requirements:

1. Ability to view the original exchange rate entered at the start of the quote, along with the date it was set.
2. Any subsequent exchange rate changes should be highlighted in red to clearly indicate the modification.
3. Display a log of all exchange rate changes with corresponding timestamps to provide transparency and tracking.

Title: Customer Segmentation & Prioritisation - Day 2-4
Description:
257 - Customer Scoring Model: 
The system must implement a scoring model that classifies customers into distinct categories based on defined criteria, enabling targeted strategies and resource allocation for opportunities coming from each customer group. 

 Some examples of customer categories:   

1. Existing Growth Customers: The system must classify customers with past wins and additional revenue potential as "Existing Growth Customers" to prioritize opportunities for expansion. 

 2. High-Value Prospects: The system must classify new customers with large IT spend and strong brand presence as "High-Value Prospects," enabling focused efforts on capturing significant market share. 

 3. Lapsed Key Accounts: The system must classify previously important customers with strained relationships as "Lapsed Key Accounts" to prioritize re-engagement and restore valuable relationships. 

 4. Strategic Accounts: The system must identify customers that align with long-term business goals as "Strategic Accounts," requiring tailored engagement strategies for sustainable growth and partnership.

Title: Manage Schemas
Description:
686 - Association of Single Schema with Multiple Accounts :

The system shall allow for the association of a single schema with multiple accounts. This means that a single schema, with its defined pricing rules, can be applied to several accounts, ensuring consistent pricing across multiple accounts while maintaining flexibility in the system. Sales users will be able to link an existing schema to multiple accounts, streamlining the management of pricing rules for similar customer profiles or requirements.

 

693 - Creation of Pricing Schema for Accounts : The system shall support the creation of a "Schema" that governs and defines the pricing rules for an account. The Schema shall include key attributes such as: Schema Name Description Owner Sales Support Price Plan Admin Region The Schema shall serve as the foundation for setting and enforcing customized pricing rules, ensuring that pricing is tailored to meet various customer requirements.

 

499 - Creation of Schema from Account  :

The system shall allow one account to be associated with only one schema, ensuring clear and distinct pricing rules for each account.

 

498 - Creation of Schema from Account:

The system shall enable the creation of a "Schema" directly from the Account in D365.

 

489 - Schema Cloning for Account Managers:

The system shall provide users with the ability to clone an existing schema. This feature will allow users to replicate an existing schema, including all its settings, pricing rules, and configurations, enabling a more efficient creation of new schemas based on pre-existing configurations. This eliminates the need for manual re-entry of details, streamlining the schema creation process.

 

692 - Schema Deletion by Account Manager :

The system shall enable Account Managers to delete old schemas from an account for which they are the primary account manager, even if the schema was originally added by someone else. This ensures that Account Managers have full control over the schemas associated with their accounts and can maintain an up-to-date and accurate pricing structure.

 

695 - Schema Modification by Sales Team Members and Authorized Stakeholders :

The system shall allow modifications to a schema by relevant stakeholders, including Specialists, Account Managers (AM), Sales Users, Sales Support, and other authorized users. This ensures that the schema can be updated as needed by individuals involved in the account or sales process, fostering collaboration and flexibility in managing pricing rules and configurations.

  

500 - Viewing Schemas for Team Accounts :

The system shall allow managers to view their team's accounts and easily access details regarding schemas are being used for each account. This feature shall enable managers to efficiently monitor and manage the schemas applied across their team's accounts, ensuring consistency and alignment with pricing strategies.

The system shall provide the users with the ability to choose the type of notifications they want for different business areas. Ability for the sales person to determine how they want the alert type i.e. Email/Teams.

Credit Limit Utilization 874
  1. The system shall have the ability to notify AM/Sales Support when the credit limit of an account reaches 90%
  2. Separate notification to be sent to the aligned specialist/sales support when the customer's credit limit reaches 90% on the account, and there is an opportunity with estimated close date in "x" days
Debtor Ageing: 870
The system shall have the ability to notify sales user for all the  ageing debtors at predefined intervals
E.g.: Daily/ fortnight notification for outstanding debtor receivables with ageing more than x days
Expiring Deal Registration: 876
System shall be able to notify AM's for the upcoming expiry of deal registrations

Expiring Quote: 869
Ability to notify AM's when the quotes are near to expiry (expiry of price validity on quotes)

Form Notifications 875
Ability to notify related teams whenever the following order types/ forms are raised (Not an exhaustive list):
Finance/leasing  - Finance team
Export Form - Export Team
Consultancy Form - Engage team

Notification for AM's Tagging: 865
The system shall have the ability to notify AM's if they get tagged in an email conversations


Notification Preference: 863
The system shall provide the users with the ability to choose the type of notifications they want for different business areas. Ability for the sales person to determine how they want the alert type i.e. Email/Teams

Notification types: 862
The system shall have the ability to configure following notification types:
Email
In App
Team
Popup

Order Hold status: 871
System shall have the ability to notify AM/specialists/sales support aligned to the account/opportunity whenever their order status is changed to hold, The notification should also mention the list of tasks required for removing the order hold status

Returns: 867
The system shall be able to notify sales users/specialists/sales support in case of return request on orders which they have previously worked on

Return request notification: 117
The system shall send notifications to the relevant parties, including the Sales Specialist, Secondary Account Manager, Executive Sponsors, and any other individuals attached to the order, whenever a return request has been raised. These notifications will ensure that all necessary stakeholders are informed of the request in a timely manner.

Notification Types: If multiple accounts experience a team change, the system should aggregate the notifications into a single, combined notification or a timeline post to avoid overwhelming the user.

Notification Content: The combined notification should clearly indicate which accounts were affected by the team changes and provide relevant details regarding the new team assignments.

220 - Order hold notification content:
The system shall send an alert to users listed on the order in D365 when an order is rejected and put on hold/open status with following details:
Order ID: The alert should include the unique identifier of the rejected order.

Next Steps for Resolution: The notification should outline the necessary steps for resolving the issue or addressing the rejection.

Title: Mobile - Lead/Opportunity Management
Description:
131 - Forecast Data: View and amend Forecast data on the mobile app via opportunities to reflect back to D365 / Pipeline

132 - Lead Management: View, amend, create Leads for associated accounts

134 - Opportunity Management : View, create and amend Opportunities which will fire automation i.e. notifications

Title: Opportunity Measurement Matrix - Day 2-4
Description:
251 - Matrix for distributing the accounts within sales team
Evaluation of account size based on the number of users, which will further help in allocation of the account to AM by the Sales Manager
Spend-Based Opportunity Evaluation:
Capture and integrate the historical (and potential) spend data as a key metric for evaluating opportunities which will be used to distribute the accounts among the sales team.

Title: Order Alignment
Description:
1651 Automated approach on pre-defined logic/criteria to have specialists automatically aligned to an opportunity when they have worked on the opportunity and should auto receive commission
57 Self-Registration: Sales team members (Specialist) must be able to register themselves against a specific order through the system.
Order Assignment: The system should allow sales team members to select or be assigned to a specific order.

Title: Order Status
Description:
426 - Hold Order Status
Once the AM raises the financing request, the system shall be able to hold the current order until Netsuite approves the order.
- Once the order is approved in NetSuite, the status will be changed to off-hold in D365.
- If the order is rejected, the status shall change to open (The reason for rejection will be captured from NetSuite).
58 - Maintain Specialist Alignment:
1) The specialist assigned to an order should remain the same even if the order status changes to Open.
2) The specialist's information (e.g., name, role) should be locked or persisted within the order record, ensuring that the assignment is not overwritten during status changes.

Title: PAR Reporting - Day 2-4
Description:
Partner Insights : 479
The system shall provide a comprehensive Account 360 view by providing a report to show revenue by specific partners/customers with the ability to break into individual lined detail

Forecast Reports based on Order ETA Dates with Multi-Year Contract Breakdown : 480

The system shall provide the ability to generate forecast reports that display order details based on ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) dates, with the ability to break down the forecast by periods (e.g., monthly, quarterly, or yearly)
Reporting on Top 10 Customers by Vertical : 478

The system shall provide the ability to generate a report that lists the top 10 customers based on specific metrics (e.g., revenue, order volume) within each vertical, such as Healthcare, Finance, Retail, etc.

Title: Partcode Localisation
Description:
336 - Part Codes Descriptions in Local Languages :
The system should be able to retrieve part codes descriptions in different languages, based on the customer's region or language preference.

Title: Partcode Creation
Description:
433 - "Configure to Order" Partcode Creation for Customers : The system shall allow the creation of customized partcodes for customers by using standard products and modifying their configurations. This functionality will enable the system to accommodate specific customer needs while maintaining the base structure of standard products.

434 - 
Automatic Partcode Creation from SSOT
The system shall allow for the automatic creation of part codes from the SSOT (Single Source of Truth) to ensure consistent and accurate part code data across the system.
438 - The system shall allow users to manually capture descriptions when creating new partcodes. The details provided shall be validated in SSOT (or any PIM solution) before it is added as a record there.

439 - The system shall allow to capture two description fields, short description and long description, during manual creation of partcodes. The user shall have an option to select which of these descriptions shall be displayed on the quote, which will then be passed to an order and invoice.


435 - Manual Partcode Creation:
The system shall also allow manual creation of part codes by the following users managed by a well-defined governance process:

439  - The system shall allow to capture two description fields, short description and long description, during manual creation of partcodes. The user shall have an option to select which of these descriptions shall be displayed on the quote, which will then be passed to an order and invoice.

448 - Dummy Partcodes for Business Areas :
The system shall include dummy partcodes (generic) for each business area, with one partcode designated for each tech tower. These partcodes shall not be orderable and shall be used solely as placeholders. They are intended for internal use to represent business areas temporarily and shall not be part of any actual order or transaction.

449 - Locking Specific Product SKUs for Modifications :
The system shall enable users to lock specific product SKUs to prevent modifications of product attributes. This functionality will ensure that product attributes of certain SKUs remain unchanged, maintaining data integrity.

472 - PAR Part Code Naming Convention :
The system shall ensure that PAR Part Codes follow a specific naming convention, with all part codes starting with the prefix 'SPT' and following the naming convention as SPT(initials)IBO(Cust initial)001,002 etc

471 - Creation of Manual Part Codes for PAR Quotes :
The system shall provide the ability to manually create Part Codes specifically for PAR Quotes and allow for tagging of the PAR Partcodes

Title: Partcode Elements & Attributes - Day 1
Description:
441 - Product Availability  and attributes:
The products shall be available in the system with Product Elements that include various attributes across different elements.

442 - Partcode Classification and Taxonomy based on Data Standardization :
The system shall support partcode classification and taxonomy aligned with the data standards established in the data program. This shall ensure that all partcode data is consistently organized and categorized according to predefined data standards, enhancing the accuracy of reporting, improving searchability, and facilitating seamless integration across systems.

Title: Partcode Lifecycle Management
Description:
445- Flagging Inactive Partcodes Based on Usage Criteria : The system shall flag inactive partcodes based on predefined usage criteria. This functionality will help identify partcodes that are no longer in use, supporting system cleanup and ensuring that only relevant and active partcodes remain in the system. This requirement will be handled outside of D365/PROS.
446 - Marking Partcodes as Deactivated/Discontinued : The system shall allow the supplier management team to manually mark partcodes as deactivated or discontinued. This ensures that the decision is based on accurate input from the team, maintaining control over partcode status changes. This requirement will be handled outside of D365/PROS.

444 -  Partcode Lifecycle Stages for Hardware/ Software Products : 1.The system shall support the following Partcode Lifecycle Stages for Hardware Products: Active Inactive End of Life 2. For Services, the system shall support the following Lifecycle Stages: Operational Retired Superseded Preview

456 -Manual Partcode Creation and Retrieval of Inactive Data :
If a partcode is not available, users shall have the option to manually create the partcode and retrieve relevant details from the inactivated version of the partcode. This will ensure that the most accurate and up-to-date partcode information is used during the quote creation process.

459 - Reactivation of Partcodes :
The system should allow the Account Managers, Product Team, and SSOT Team to handle the reactivation of partcodes. Once reactivated, the updated partcode details should be automatically pushed to SSOT for synchronization, ensuring that all relevant systems are updated with the most current partcode information.

Title: Partcode Search and Integration
Description:
452- Advanced Partcode Search with Filters : The system shall provide the ability to easily search for partcodes using various filters, including options to filter by imported/exported partcodes, distributor, vendor, manufacturer, and other relevant criteria.
450- Integrated Partcode Search in Quote Creation : The system shall integrate partcode search directly within the quote creation process, allowing users to access it during quote creation, rather than relying on an external tool as is the current process. This integration will streamline the quoting process and improve efficiency.

453 - Preferred Supplier List in Partcode Search for Quotes : The system shall provide a list of preferred suppliers in the partcode search window when creating a quote, based on predefined criteria. This will streamline the selection process by highlighting the most relevant and preferred suppliers, ensuring consistency and improving efficiency during quote creation.

451 - Search Partcodes by Description :
The system shall have the ability to search for partcodes by their description, in addition to the partcode name. The search shall be a quick find search, displaying suggested products while typing.
This will improve search flexibility, allowing users to find partcodes based on descriptive terms or details rather than just the part code identifier.

Title: PAR Quote Management - Day 2-4
Description:
252 - Automated Partner Selection: 
The system must automatically suggest relevant partners when selecting a product or service, streamlining the partner selection process based on predefined criteria such as product compatibility, historical performance, and strategic fit.
 254 - Compliance with Approved Partner Relationships: 
The system must ensure that only approved or managed partners can be engaged directly, maintaining compliance with internal policies and strategic partner agreements.

253 - Immediate Partner Engagement: 
Users must be able to select and engage with the suggested partners immediately, without waiting for manual responses, enabling faster decision-making and collaboration.

Title: Partner/ Consultancy Selection Process - Day 2-4
Description:
258 -Internal Resource Availability Check: 
The system shall automatically assess internal team availability to fulfil a service request, providing real-time visibility into resource allocation and capacity.
260 -Partner Database & Capability Mapping: 
The system shall maintain a comprehensive directory of partners, categorized by expertise, service offerings, and availability, enabling efficient partner selection based on specific service needs.

259 -Partner Service Matching: 
If internal resources are unavailable, the system must identify and suggest relevant partners who can provide the required service, ensuring minimal service disruption.

Title: Manage Price Plans - Day 1
Description:
495 - Associating Price Plans (Schema Templates) with Multiple Schemas :
The system shall provide the ability to associate a Price Plan with multiple schemas, allowing for flexible and efficient pricing management across different schemas. This functionality will enable the application of consistent pricing rules to various accounts, ensuring uniformity while maintaining flexibility in managing different schemas.

494 -Price Plan Creation and Management : 
A centralised team shall be responsible for creating and managing Price Plans, ensuring consistent pricing across the system for all relevant product types. This responsibility ensures that pricing remains aligned and standardized across various levels of the product catalog.

 493 -Price Plan Creation and Management :
The system shall provide the ability to create Price Plans (pricing templates for Schemas) that define fixed pricing parameters for each product type across different levels. This shall allow for consistent and predefined pricing rules to be applied to products based on their type and associated criteria.

Title: Bundling and BTO Capabilities - Day 2-4
Description:
512- Ability to build different bundle types on quote as follows (Not an exclusive list)
1. BTO Bundles - Bundling of standard items to build a custom product offering for the customer
2. Upsell Product bundles - Bundling of a core product ( hardware or software) with related products ( accessorised, warranties or services).
511 - BTO Products Requirements:
When bundled products are added to a quote, they should appear as separate line items in the quote once uploaded. There should be a quote divider (along with divider comments and subtotals) to identify those line items as a part of bundled product.

Title: Quote Product Selection
Description:
505 - Add or Edit Shipping as a Line Item on the Quote :
The system shall allow users to add multiple shipping costs as line items on the quote or edit existing shipping line items. This functionality should support the ability to add different delivery types and charges when quotes include products coming from multiple sources.
507 - Change Part Code Description for a Quote ( one time change) :
The system shall allow users to modify the description of a part code for a specific quote, with the change reflecting on the invoice generated from that quote. This change shall be applied for that particular instance only, ensuring the modified description is not carried over to other quotes or invoices associated with the same part code. The modified description shall appear on the invoice generated from the quote as per the one-time change

515 -Add Product Comments to Product Lines or Overall Quote :
The system shall allow users to add product comments to individual product lines within a quote, as well as the option to add general comments for the overall quote.

503 - Adding Products to the Quote :
The ability to create new part codes if necessary when adding products that are not already listed in the system.

502 - Adding Products to the Quote :
While adding products to a quote, ability to select margins, specify quantities, and apply discounts to the added products.

504 - Adding Products to the Quote :
The ability to view detailed product descriptions (such as component level information for a laptop) while creating a quote.

506 - Buy Price for Special Price Contracts During Quote Generation :
The system shall allow the amendment of the buy price of products during quote generation for special price contracts. This functionality shall be enabled when the quote is created under a special pricing agreement, providing flexibility to adjust pricing in accordance with the terms of the contract.

519 - Show/ Hide Part code information :
The system should provide the ability to include or hide part codes information on quotes based on user preference or specific requirements.

Title: Product Recommendation
Description:
518 Product Upsell and Cross-Sell Automation :
The system shall identify opportunities to add complementary products or services to an existing quote, providing relevant recommendations for account managers or sales teams to revisit the quote.
517 - Product Upsell and Cross-Sell Automation :
The system shall automatically generate upsell and cross-sell product suggestions based on the products added in the quote, eliminating the need for manual intervention.

Title: Product Comparison
Description:
516 - Product Comparison Capability at the Time of Quoting :
The system shall support product comparison at the time of adding products to a quote with the following requirements:

1.Attribute-Based Comparison: The ability to compare products based on various attributes, such as features, specifications, and performance characteristics.

2. Attribute-Level Comparison: Provide a detailed comparison at the attribute level, allowing users to see how individual attributes of products differ to aid in decision-making during the quoting process.

Title: Quote Partcodes
Description:
1966 - The ability for the Admin Team and specific Super Users to manage, view, and search the product catalogue within D365 and/or PROS. The product catalogue must display the full hierarchy of products (e.g. parent, child, bundles, variants) along with associated attributes (e.g. pricing, availability, categories, tags, compatibility). Users must be able to perform advanced searches and administer updates 

454 Active Partcode Selection for Quotes : The system shall ensure that only partcodes in the "Active" or "Legacy" stage can be added to a quote. Partcodes that are "Inactive" or "End of Life" should be restricted and unavailable for selection when creating or modifying a quote.

437 - Renewal Date Capture for Renewable Partcodes : The system shall enable the Bulk update of the renewal dates for renewable partcodes by selecting the relevant order line items. This functionality will ensure that users can easily monitor and manage the renewal timelines for partcodes that require periodic renewals, helping to streamline the renewal process and reduce the risk of missed renewal opportunities.

440 - Restriction on Account Managers (AMs) Updating Partcode Descriptions : The system shall restrict Account Managers (AMs) from directly updating partcode descriptions. Instead, a formal ticketing process must be implemented to handle any updates to partcode descriptions. This process shall ensure that all changes are made in a controlled, accurate, and traceable manner, maintaining the integrity of the data and providing visibility into the updates.

447 -Single use Part codes Re-Use:
The system shall not allow reuse of a single use part code by default, particularly when the partcode is associated with internal or partner services rather than physical products or licenses.

481 - Reusable Part Codes for PAR Quotes :
The system shall allow for reusable part codes to be used within PAR Quotes. PAR AMs (Account Managers) should have the ability to update or modify the line item descriptions associated with these part codes.

602 - The system shall allow the user to amend the product description and/or choose product attributes to highlight that the quote is for a renewal

458 - Flagging Non-Refundable Non-Returnable (NRNR) Partcodes at Partcode Level :
The system shall flag non-refundable Non- Returnable partcodes at the partcode level, coming from the vendor, to indicate that the partcode is non-refundable/ non-returnable.

457 - Flagging Non-Refundable Non-Returnable (NRNR) Partcodes at Quote Level : The system shall flag non-refundable Non- Returnable partcodes at the quote level to ensure clarity and transparency, providing users with clear visibility of non-refundable/ non-returnable partcodes throughout the quoting process.

Title: Manage Supplier Quotes
Description:
597 -  For the quotes with a Quote reference ID, the system shall support the inclusion of additional information such as supplier name, supplier specification for select or all line items, software license coverage etc.

626 - The system shall provide the ability to add a "Quote Reference ID" and "Supplier Name" to a quote. These shall not be visible in the customer facing quote but shall be communicated to Netsuite for a simpler downstream process. 
These can be applied at either the quote header level (where the same Quote Ref ID and Supplier Name apply to all SKUs) or at the product line level (allowing different Quote Ref IDs and Suppliers for individual SKUs).

629 -For the quotes with a "Quote Reference ID", based on the supplier name captured in the quote, display a prompt for select vendors, reminding the user to confirm if the applicable percentage discount or fee has been factored into the quote.

627 - Vendor/Distributor Quote Creation Requirements :
In a scenario where the quote (pdf or excel format) is shared by vendor or distributor, the system shall allow the user to upload the quote into the new system and automatically create a quote based on the uploaded document.

Title: Reports and Dashboards
Description:
593 - Sales Team Dashboard and Quote Stage View :
The system shall provide a dashboard for the Sales team to view quotes categorized by their respective stages.
345 - Multinational Business Reporting Capability :
The system should provide the ability to easily report on all global business operations, including:
1.Entity Business: Report on transactions and activities related to each entity within the global organization.
2.Export Business: Track and report on all export-related activities, including export quotes, shipments, and compliance.

Title: Quote Templates
Description:
547-  Divide Quotes into Sections or Billing Options :
The system shall provide the ability to divide a quote into different sections or billing options, allowing users to view and compare multiple options while quoting. Each option should be able to be stored separately, with the ability to display a subtotal for each option

546 -Edit Quote template :
The system shall provide users with the ability to edit quote templates directly within the platform. This includes ability to modify certain fields, which will be defined by the business during Design phase of project catalyst.

545 - Quote Template Creation :
The system shall include product/component specifications as a column in the quote document.

543 - Quote Template Creation :
The system shall provide the ability to create quote templates that include both static and dynamically populated information. The Quote document shall be tidy and free of redundant white space, ensuring a clean and professional presentation of the quote.

544 -Quote Template Creation :
The system shall provide users with the ability to create and customize quote templates for different customers or specific types of orders (e.g., Service orders).

1790 -Ability to store the customer logo as an attachment against the customer account and have this pull through to display on any quotes for that customer

Title: Rebates - Day 2-4
Description:
62 - Customer Rebates:
- System shall be able to capture and store customer rebate model/ information data, which will be impacting the GP from the order. 
-System shall have the ability to make GP adjustments whenever customer rebates are raised. 
- The system shall have the ability to flag customer orders qualifying for rebates.

61 - Rebate Account level Tracking
System should be able to track rebates at  account level by highlighting - Spent vs Pending against a rebate agreement
- Visibility of agreements at account page
59 - Rebate Visibility
System should have the ability to flag vendor rebates at the time of quote/order creation stage to provide visibility to AM and Specialist for the future GP adjustments

60  - Rebate Tracking Dashboard:
- List of upcoming rebates according to customers purchase trends
- Due date for the upcoming rebates
- Current spend versus next rebate gate

145 - Centralized vendor rebate information
D365 should have the ability to centrally store vendor rebate information/contracts which is currently stored in Vendor Alliance spreadsheets

Title: Renewals Management - Day 1
Description:
283- Automated Reminders:
Notifications should be generated at defined timelines months/days  before renewal (configurable based on business rules or vendor suggestions).  
- Ability to flow Notifications/reminders to the current AM if there has been a change in AM (with ability to override date

286- Document upload functionality
System shall allow users to upload documents as attachment directly into the CRM, associating them with the relevant accounts or renewals / any opportunity records on the platform

287- Priority-Based Follow-ups:
The system must flag high-value renewals separately to ensure they are prioritized and prevent them from being overlooked, enabling timely and focused follow-up actions.

285 - Reminder frequency
Enable users to define the reminder frequency for a renewal, tailored to the type of renewal (e.g., monthly, quarterly, or custom).

282 - Renewal Tracking:
The system should be able to record renewal dates when an order is placed with AM's ability to overwrite.

284 - Stop Notification
System shall provide an option to flag and stop notifications, allowing users to pause notifications for a specific renewal or task when necessary along with a reason. Flag will be present on related opportunity to stop notifications

288 - Upcoming Renewals List:
- Display a comprehensive list of upcoming renewals for accounts assigned to the user.
- Allow users to filter and sort renewals by date, account, or priority.
275 - The system shall provide the necessary information to sales users for effective Renewal Service meetings with clients, which include:(Not exclusive list) 1) Quarterly Business Review (QBR) Information: - Display the total number of renewals for the quarter. - Provide the number of renewals completed on time. 2) Operational Review Information: - List upcoming renewals, including renewal dates and relevant client details. - Notification to the Renewals Service Team and also account management team for tracking all upcoming renewals to prevent any oversights. 

(Previous Version) The system shall provide the necessary information for effective Renewal Service meetings with clients, which include: 1) Quarterly Business Review (QBR) Information: - Display the total number of renewals for the quarter. - Provide the number of renewals completed on time. - Present the cost savings achieved through renewals. 2) Operational Review Information: - List upcoming renewals, including renewal dates and relevant client details. - Notification to the Renewal Desk for tracking all upcoming renewals to prevent any oversights.

277 - Reason capturing for lost renewals:
System should mandate sales user to input a reason in case the customer chose not to renew the service. This will be mandatory for all renewals lost over a certain GP threshols (likely based on a % of the individual's target, tbc)

278 - Competition analysis:
In case of renewal lost to competitors, competitors name should be captured in the system along with a detailed description of reason

281 - Renewal Quote/Order Cloning Option:
The system must provide users with the option to enable quote or order cloning from the quote/order related to the previous opportunity, allowing for quicker and more efficient generation of renewal quotes based on existing terms and conditions with a prompt to check pricing before adding this bit to quote

276 - External renewal notification to customer
The system shall allow users to specify if an external renewal notification can be sent to customers, ensuring timely communication with clients regarding renewals.

279 - Renewal Notification for Account Manager Change:
The system should send a renewal notification to the holding account manager (and aligned members in the accounting team) in case of any change in the account manager, ensuring that the new account manager is promptly informed about the upcoming renewal.

1766 - License term details (start and renewal dates) to be included on the quote and invoices. The license terms details shall be captured in Netsuite and fed into D365 and PROS. Alternatively, they can be entered manually by the user in case this information is not available in Netsuite at the time of quoting.

Title: Reporting & Dashboards - Day 1
Description:
878 - AM Dashboard:
Ability to have an overview dashboard mentioning the following information:
  • All the accounts (Current and past) under an AM
- Region of the accounts
- Whether they are holding more accounts than the defined limits

880 - Case Management Report
Ability to have a power BI report for all the cases
882 - Consultancy Service:
Ability to have a consultancy service report mentioning the following information:
- Won/Lost deals
-Customer region
883 - Consultancy utilization:
Ability to have a report defining the AM's and regions which has the highest consultancy service utilization
891 - Customer Experience Survey
Ability to have a report mentioning a consolidated view of CX survey feedback and trend in service satisfaction levels over a period of time, factoring in the spend information
E.g. the survey was from when account was at 50k spend now 100k
888 - Customer Reports:
Ability to have a report mentioning following information:
Spends by customer name
Product sold
GP Earned
895 - Export Quote Report:
Ability to have a report mentioning following export information
List to show all export quote requests showing order details
Order placed vs fulfilled data. Example: order says 500 but only 5 fulfilled

886 - Finance Orders:
Ability to have a report on finance orders with breakdown of products, Margins, financing partner details, Financing Period, etc.
881 - Framework Reports:
Ability to have a report mentioning the customer spends and product purchase information against frameworks
894 - Global Business Reporting:
The systems shall be able to have a reporting mentioning following information for  account covering multiple regions :
-Revenue split by region
-list of related account
-Order split by currency
-Split by outstanding / invoiced(paid)
892 - Managers Report:
Ability to have a report mentioning following information:
-Revenue earned at teams level
-Gross profit earned
1643 - The system shall have a management report to show users who have been underperforming based on set criteria for a specified length of time.
Utilise copilot to suggest relevant training resources that are available 


1645 - Overperformance sales manager report:
Ability to report on users' GP overperformance on target and be able to drill into details to analyse trends and review key attributes, and understand what is going well to help educate.

Understand what are the repeatable behaviours of successful sales people


890 - Partner Alliance Report
Ability to have a report mentioning following information:
- Partner Details
-Invoices generate/ Revenue Earned
877 - Purchase history:
The system shall be able to provide the list of key vendors the customer has purchased in the past

123 - QBR Report Generation: 
The system should be able to generate a QBR report for each customer at the end of each quarter, pulling data from various sources (e.g., sales, support, service performance).

889 - Renewals Report:
Ability to have a report mentioning following information:
- Renewals Type
-Revenue earned

1650 - Sales Management report:
Out-of-region account agreements - time-limited based on activity and should show review date for sales manager to review and agree or bring back to correct region 

27 - Reporting - Activity Summary: 
Centralized report to see a summary of the recent activities such as but not limited to Phone Calls, Emails, Meetings with Co-Pilot analysis over a specified date range

893 - Resource Reports:
Ability to have a report mentioning the revenue earned/ deals won when a Chief Strategist, Chief Technologist, or other internal Softcat resource without sales target is aligned to a deal

887 - Revenue Report:
Ability to have reports mentioning the following information for the defined period:
- Source (eCat, Sales team, etc.)
- Billing amounts
-Cost of goods sold
-Gross Profit
1646 - Sales Management report
A report on trend analysis of successes or failures in sales/activities/ customer health scores /performance /Team collaboration

1648 - Sales management reporting:
Future target reporting utilizing copilot to calculate suggested targets based on previous performance, potential pipeline, and account market share potential

1649 - Sales Management reporting:
Report on success metrics for shared accounts vs single-managed accounts with performance statistics

1647 - Sales Management reporting:
Region evaluation report based on variable metrics such as call stats vs sales performance vs SME vs retention

884 - Sales support involvement:
Ability to have a report mentioning the involvement of sales support on deals and results of the deals (won/lost)
879 - Specialist Dashboard:
Ability to have a dashboard, mentioning all the orders and product details for which the specialist has been aligned

885 - Vendor Report:
Ability to have vendor report comparing vendors based on the following:
  • Number of products sold over a defined period
  • Region wise sales number
  • Customers who have bought vendor "x" but not vendor "y"

Title: Request Submission - Day 2-4
Description:
82 - Involvement of Technical Service team:
The system shall have the ability to involve technical and service teams for effort estimation calculation when a Tech and Service quote need to be initiated

83 - Request Submission to Engage Team:
The system shall provide the ability to raise a request to the Engage team from an opportunity, automatically creating a case or task in Zendesk for further action.

Title: Returns Reporting - Day 2-4
Description:
114 - Managers view The new system should provide Account Managers (AMS) with a dashboard showing all open cases across accounts, including tracking info and action alerts, without needing to access each account.

116 - Ability to define SLA for closure of returns request on a timely basis and Mapping of each request against the defined SLA

Title: Schema Setup and Configuration
Description:
698 - Schema Configuration by Individual product:

700 - Schema Configuration by Manufacturer Group:
In a schema, the system shall allow users to manage pricing rules at the Manufacturer Group Level, enabling the application of consistent pricing strategies across all products from a specific manufacturer. These features will simplify pricing management and ensure uniformity across a broad range of products from the same manufacturer. For example, Dell laptops

699 - Schema Configuration by Product Group:

698 - Schema Configuration by Individual product:

700 - Schema Configuration by Manufacturer Group:

Product Level

490 - Currency Alignment with Admin Region in Schema:
The system shall ensure that the currency of a schema is guided by the "Admin region" set within the schema. For the schema to be applied to a specific account, the currency settings in the schema must align with the region defined at the account level. This ensures that the schema's currency rules are consistently applied to accounts, guaranteeing accurate and region-specific pricing

487 - Rule Customization for eCAT Integration :
The system shall allow the user to Enable or disable the following rules / configuration  :
1.Publish to eCAT ( Enable/ Disable Pricing Updates from Schema on eCAT )
2. Send all quotes to eCAT ( Enable sharing quotes to eCAT)
3. Use recent system prices on eCAT ( Override eCAT Pricing from D365)
4. Use sales order to set prices on eCAT ( Sales Order Pricing Override for eCAT )

486 - Exclusion of Line Items During Schema Creation :
The system shall allow users to exclude specific line items from the selected Price Plan during schema creation. This functionality enables users to customize the pricing structure by removing certain line items that do not apply in eCAT, ensuring that the schema accurately reflects the needs of the account or specific pricing requirements.

492 - Hierarchical Pricing Structure within Schema :
The system shall apply pricing based on a hierarchical structure within a schema. The pricing process will begin with the base Price Plan, followed by any applicable pricing at the Product Level, Product Group Level, and Manufacturer Group Level. This hierarchy ensures consistency and flexibility, with the base pricing from the Price Plan being applied first, and any overrides or adjustments being applied in order of specificity�first at the Product Level, then Product Group Level, and finally Manufacturer Group Level�ensuring that the most accurate and relevant pricing is applied to each product.


484 - Schema Configuration for eCAT Pricing Override :
While creating a new schema, the user shall be able to enable/disable the "Override eCAT Pricing" feature. This shall automatically update and override all prices in eCAT based on the latest prices in D365 when the "Override eCAT Pricing" feature is enabled on the schema in D365. This override will apply to all affected products, ensuring uniform pricing across both eCAT and D365.

488 - Schema Configuration for quote updates on eCAT :
While creating a new schema, the user shall have the ability to enable or disable the "Enable sharing quotes to eCAT" feature. This ensures that any quotes created using the schema are automatically shared with eCAT, providing consistent and up-to-date pricing information across all sales channels.

485 - Schema Configuration for Sales Order Pricing Override :
While creating a new schema, the user shall be able to enable/disable the "Sales Order Pricing Override" feature. This shall automatically override all prices for open orders using the pricing available in eCAT when the "Sales Order Pricing Override" feature is enabled in the schema. This ensures that the pricing remains consistent across the system for all active transactions, reflecting the most recent pricing applied through the sales order.

687 - Static Price Configuration with Buy Price Override :
The system shall allow users to set a static price for products within the schema. However, if there is an increase in the buy price of the product beyond a certain threshold %, the system shall provide a notification to AM stating to consider the drop in GP due to price change. This ensures that the pricing remains aligned with the latest buy price changes while maintaining the margin structure set within the schema.

Optimise Product (part code) catalogue data structure and attributes for searching and browsing by Sales teams. Matt Lawrence and Surinder currently exploring with both Cisco and Dell.

1733

1704
Creation of centralised request and notification queues for workflows related to verification, update, error flagging or validation of data within the platform. Customer data issues that result from data entry in D365 may also be flagged via other platforms (e.g. Service Now).

To enable effective management of these processes, it must be possible to view, manage and action the backlog of outstanding data update or error notifications in a single place. For Customer data, requests or activities generated off-platform (e.g. in Service Now) should also be browsable within D365.

1702

Title: Technology Stack, Platform and Model Management - Data Integrations
Description:
Ensure clear principles are in place to guide how data from Dynamics 365 and PROS is sourced for Softcat's BI and Reporting. For example, what reporting is done directly from Platform data vs. sourced from curated data sources in EDW or ADP.

Further exploration is needed in Plan, Analyse, Design to determine what reporting can be done on-platform.

Creation of required integration(s) to allow data from D365 and PROS to be included in to Softcat's existing and planned Data Quality assurance and reporting processes. Customer DQ reporting is currently fed from data in EDW which would have been originally retrieved from SLX via SSoT/Boomi. Expected that at least a daily refresh of data would be required.

Clear, agreed data contracts in place to govern data passed through integrations between D365, PROS and subscriber systems. A data contract would be proposed and agreed between the development teams for the systems or databases that are expected to be exchanging data. At a high-level, a data contract would be expected to include:

- Data structures and schemas - e.g. data types, column names, relationships, validation rules, transfer method)
- Expected data formats (e.g. file type, file names etc)
- Any security or access restrictions
- SLAs and validation and quality rules
- Key owners and contacts, including escalation and incident routes

It would be an advantage to have more real time information available via distributor/vendor integrations. This is not seen as a day 1 requirement but areas highlighted are:

- Price breaks
- Longer than 24hr delivery
- Price trends
- Expected future stock (i.e. future stock levels)

Design and implementation of a single integration pattern for sharing Customer and Sales master data from D365/PROS via SSoT. This will prevent data duplication and misalignment.
Ensure integrations are in place to allow Customer and Sales master data from D365 to be supplied to all 'subscriber' systems that need it. This will prevent duplication of Customer and Sales master data or misalignment of Customer and Sales records between systems. Appropriate integrations are crucial to make this architectural principle a practical reality.

1731
The system will calculate GP of Quotes (Forecast/Pipeline) & Orders to accurately measure the performance of AMs and determine their commission. This calculation will ensure transparency in sales reporting and align with commission structure.

  • GP Calculation Methodology: GP should be calculated as the difference between Sell Price & Sell Price for each Quote / Order.
  • Commission Alignment: The GP calculation shall directly impact commission pay-outs, ensuring AMs are compensated based on the profitability of their sales.
  • Transaction Level and Aggregate GP: GP shall be visible at both individual transaction level and aggregated levels (e.g. monthly, quarterly, yearly) for performance tracking.
  • Integration with Sales Reporting: The GP data shall be integrated into reporting dashboards for real-time visibility of sales performance.
  • Adjustments for Split Commission: The GP calculation for each AM shall factor in any adjustments, including split commissions when multiple AMs are involved e.g. PAR 
  • Flexibility in GP Calculation: The system shall allow adjustments in GP calculations based on business needs, such as considering discounts, rebates, special pricing agreements, and commission-sharing rules.
  • Additional GP adjustment types: Reset primary Account Manager, GP month move, GP adjustment etc.

Title: Data Migration Architecture Build and Deployment
Description:
• Softcat infrastructure, networking and technical teams will set up and prepare necessary environments/DBs for data extraction within the identified source systems. 

  • Following our principle of extracting data from the existing master source to ensure accuracy and integrity of data, this will involve setting up data extraction environments/DBs in SLX, NetSuite and SSOT. Where internal tools are the source, we propose this data is manually extracted. 

  • It is proposed that a single environment per identified data source will be used to extract production grade data (i.e. a pre-prod environment). These environments will need to be refreshed by Softcat ahead of each data conversion cycle. Approach will minimise any disruption to performance of live systems

  • There is an opportunity to explore pre-staging of data in source system DBs by Softcat team to facilitate efficiency of the data extraction process. This will be explored in more detail during detailed design. 

  • Oakland data engineers will set up the data migration environment in the Azure Data Platform (ADP) and pipelines for delivering and converting source data into the designated staging database per the high-level data conversion architecture below.  

  • It is proposed that a single environment can be used within ADP to deliver the necessary data at required intervals into a designated staging database for load into the Dynamics 365 and PROS environments.  

  • We propose the use of the existing ADP Dev environment, however mechanism / approach to be explored and reviewed during detailed design on how to separate out Catalyst data migration cloud costs from existing Data Programme activity as a key requirement flagged by Softcat i.e., separate schemas, clusters or resource groups. 

  • Separate tables and notebooks will also be established within the respective data stores to ensure Catalyst data conversion activity is appropriately segregated and secured. 

  • Support will be needed from Softcat infrastructure, networking and technical teams to support the Oakland team in establishing connections from the identified data sources to ADP. Given the volume and variety of data involved, with the exception of data held within internal tools, manual extraction is not viable, therefore integration pipelines for automated ingestion will be established. This will also minimise ongoing future manual effort in support data conversion activity.  

  • The Avanade team will set up the necessary D365 and PROS environments in alignment with respective conversion cycle. 

  • The Avanade team will set up the necessary pipelines for data ingestion from the designated staging database in ADP via Azure Data Factory (ADF) into Dynamics and PROS environments. Native connector exists into Dynamics to support this.

Title: Data Migration Cycle 1 Reporting, Validation, Assessment and Refinement
Description:
Data conversion reporting, validation, assessment and refinement: 

  • During each data conversion cycle, there will be both technical and functional reporting and validation. These will all be tracked in a single migration tracker per conversion cycle. 

  • Oakland will deliver reporting related to successful data conversion and script execution through the data pipeline into the staging database. This will include: 

  • Data conversion performance from source to staging database i.e., processing time for staging of data. 

  • Data conversion details tracking count of data rows successfully converted into staging database i.e., conversion from source to staging database. 

  • Error and exception report highlighting the reasons for any record extraction and conversion failure and required remediation. 

  • Avanade will deliver reporting related to successful load of data packages from the staging database via ADF, including: 

  • Data load performance from staging database into Dynamics 365 and PROS. 

  • Data load details tracking count of data rows successfully loaded or failed i.e., 1000 records in the load file, 900 loaded successfully and 100 failed. 

  • Error and exception report highlighting the reasons for any record load failure and required remediation i.e., row failed due to missing Account ID, Account ID must be loaded first or conversion script updated to capture missed Accounts or Account ID corrected if not accurate. 

  • Softcat SMEs and Process Owners will conduct sample testing in the designated Dynamics 365 and PROS environments to validate data has been correctly loaded.  

  • Data conversion success and identified issues will be assessed following each data conversion cycle and approach refined as appropriate depending on required remediation i.e., updates to scripts or deployment packages.

The system shall give the ability on an account level to flag if it is a top account.

179 - Locking of Account Vertical Field

1) An account's vertical (e.g., Education, Healthcare, Corporate) must be locked after creation.
2) Users should not be able to manually change the vertical of an existing account.

Title: Manage Payment, Currency, Tax & Exchange Rates - Day 2-4
Description:
621 - Proforma Quotes Requirements:
For proforma quotes, the system should be capable of managing instant payment methods, such as credit cards, for transactions in case of immediate payments.

Title: Address Management - Day 2-4
Description:
184
1. The system should allow only one registered address per company.
2. Once set, the registered address should be non-editable and cannot be changed by users without the necessary administrative approval or process

192
Secured address classification
The system should introduce a secured address classification for locations that require restricted visibility.

1639
Ability to escalate when address wrong:
If the address information is wrong, there should be an escalation process to customer insights team to review and edit

Title: Contact Management - Day 2-4
Description:
335 - Contact Number Country Code Auto-Population :
When inputting a contact's number on a contact, the country code should automatically populate based on the country of the account/contact. This field should remain editable, allowing the country code to be manually changed if needed, and replicated on the associated delivery address

24 - LinkedIn Contact Role Updates: Upon role changed tracked on LinkedIn for associated contacts assigned to an AM, notify of role change to engage contact

Title: Case Creation - Day 2-4
Description:
102
Field for uploading case-related attachments: Depending on the reason code selected, the system should provide a separate popup for uploading images related to damaged products, invoice etc.

112
AM Approval for email requests: The system shall send a notification via MS Teams to the Account Manager (AM) instead of an email when a request is raised. Once the AM approves the notification, the system shall automatically create a case in the system, ensuring seamless case creation and approval workflow.

Title: Quote and Order Approvals - Day 2-4
Description:
520 - Quote Value and product Approvals:
Quote approval should be required based on the predefined set of criteria including but not limited to Deal value, Product category, credit limit thresholds, Margin thresholds ( Negative margin etc).

Title: Opportunity Creation - Day 2-4
Description:
248
Clone Opportunity:
1)System shall provide the ability to clone an existing opportunity. Cloning all fields of an exiting opportunity, with an ability to edit the copied fields
2) Ability to link the cloned opportunity back to the original opportunity.

Title: Resource Alignment - Day 2-4
Description:
221
Automated Specialist Suggestions: 1) Implement a recommendation engine to suggest relevant specialists based on customer profile, opportunity type, and historical data with an ability for AM to reject the suggestion and manually select a specialist 2) Provide account managers with a list of suggested specialists for a given opportunity. 3) This would be relevant only where there isnt already an aligned specialist for that area; no interest in suggesting alternatives to in situ account teams.

228
Sales support alignment
System should automatically assign sales support/ specialist sales supports to an opportunity for the specialists/ account manager they represent according to those assigned within the system. System should also show these people on the account team view

229
Auto-Assignment of Opportunity Ownership: When a new opportunity is created and there is a specialist assigned to the account of the opportunity, if the opportunity includes products/ services that are relevant to a specialist type, then the system should auto align that specialist to that opportunity

Title: Billing Profiles - Day 2-4
Description:
68: Configuration of Billing Type (Milestone or Amount):
The system shall allow users to configure whether billing should be based on milestones or a specific amount, providing flexibility in defining billing structures for various projects or services.

Title: User Roles and Permissions - Day 2-4
Description:
155 - System shall enable the following views based on the User respective role

Account Manager View:
1. Display relationship tracking information, including last contact date and key stakeholders involved.
2. Integrate with ServiceNow to show open tickets and alerts for any active service issues.
Provide a comprehensive 360� customer view by displaying critical data from Dynamics (e.g., invoices, orders, cases).

Specialist View:
1.Highlight sold products and whitespace opportunities (i.e., products not yet sold to the account).
2. Integrate with CPQ/AI systems and suggest new sales opportunities based on existing account data.

Sales Support View:
1. Enable the selection of account planning templates based on the size and complexity of the account.
2. Offer structured sequences to guide users through the account planning process, ensuring consistency across different teams.

Additional Views for consideration (not exhaustive list):

  1. Sales Ops
  2. Management Levels
  3. Vendor Alliances
  4. Marketing
  5. Customer Experience

Title: Consumption Billing - Day 2-4
Description:
355 - Governance:
Upon receiving vendor T&Cs,  Should be sent to the AM/specialist, they should attach them to the order, which should then be shared with Category management on order being placed. Category Management will then send to customer via docusign manually

365 - DocuSign Integration:
Ability to sign consumption certificated and T&C for Softcat, Vendor and Customer using DocuSign and post to the audit table

Title: MDL - Day 2-4
Description:
358 - Integration with Service Now
Once the quote has been accepted, D365 should be able to transfer the order data to service now for identifying entitlements for the account.

Title: Procurement Route Restriction - Day 2-4
Description: 1584 -Exceptional Approval Request: Ability to trigger exception approval request to a designated Softcat team, in case the customer territory is outside the serviceable territory of vendor.

Title: Billing and Shipping Management - Day 2-4
Description:
850 - Ship Via Order Validation:
The system shall validate 'Ship Via' orders to ensure that signed "Bill and Hold" documents are attached, and have a valid date, before the order is submitted to NetSuite.

859 - Shipping Address Review Flag:
For 'Ship via' export quotes, the system shall flag the quote as 'Potential Review for ILAC Team' if the end user address is different country/ customs union from the stock holding location.

Title: PAR Quote Management - Day 2-4
Description:
475 - Custom Quote Template for PAR Orders:
The system shall provide the ability to create and use a specific quote template for PAR quotes.. This template should allow for the inclusion of custom labels and Terms & Conditions (T&Cs) that are specific to Partner Alliance transactions

474 - Automatic Quote Creation from Partner Quote:
The system shall provide the ability to automatically create a quote in D365/PROS from a quote received from a partner.

Title: Forecast Confidence - Day 2-4
Description:
264 - Manual forecast change by manager
System shall enable managers to change the confidence forecast per person (but the user shouldn't see this change)

Title: Copilot - Account Activity - Day 2-4
Description:
23 - Alignment of task: Ability to create tasks to show within "Manage my day/ Week" dashboard by summarising upcoming meeting, task, overdue action items and other activities for the defined time frame

17 - Auto Create Meeting from Teams: Once a phone call has been ended via MS Teams to auto-create a meeting record, assign tasks to users, create meeting digest and provide a sentiment analysis, mentioned capabilities will allow users to better align and prepare for meetings
94- Communication summary: The system shall be capable of summarising all account communications to facilitate a smooth handover process when transitioning from one Account Manager (AM) to another. The summary should include key interactions, updates, and important details relevant to the account, ensuring continuity and efficiency

22- Missing information email recommendation: Email recommendations - Ability to provide recommendation on missing information in an email based on customer calls, notes, purchase history etc.

Title: Mobile - Activity Management - Day 2-4
Description:
31 - Voice inputs Ability to create actions or run reports by using voice inputs "Give me top 5 Products in the last year" / "Create me a task for "x" account for tomorrow"
133 - LinkedIn Functionality Leverage LinkedIn functionality via the Mobile app to view Account and Contact data as well as add new information

130
Copilot on Mobile Leverage Copilot via the Mobile app to see summary and ask Copilot questions based on associated activity

Title: Split Billing - Day 2-4
Description:
365 - PO Validity Notification for multiple/split PO's
The system shall provide notification to AM in case the tenure for multiple/split  PO is about to expire and PO for the next period need to be followed up with the customer

1537 - Notification 30 days PO:
Notification to Sales 30 days in advance of a new PO being required to prompt the sales person to obtain the PO. Where the customer has provided Purchase Order (PO) only for 1 billing period, the user shall be able to view a combined view of all orders where the PO is pending for subsequent billing periods

Title: Cloud Billing - Day 2-4
Description: 97 - Notification to AM: System should notify the AM though a popup/notification their account drops or about to drop from A to B

Title: GP Reporting - Day 2-4
Description:
48 - Commission log: 
The system shall maintain a log of all order registrations for audit and commission tracking purposes for specialists.

Title: Document & Knowledge Management Day 1
Description:
952 - Common SharePoint:
The system shall have a common share point for Bid team/ Commercial/ PS BD/ Category Management, as required to share bid related documents and information with restrictions being set per specific roles

Title: Frameworks & Strategic Initiatives - Day 1
Description:
922 -Lost Bid analysis:
The system shall be able to track details of the lost bids, along with the lost reason captured by AM

Title: GP Splitting - Day 1
Description:
51 - Account Splitting:
- The system should enable account splits between two Account Managers (AMs) or two Specialists at the account level or for individual orders created from that account.
- The split percentage or amount should be configurable for each user (AM/Specialist) involved in the account/ order.
- The system should ensure that the total commission split between the AMs/Specialists equals the total commission for the order.

Title: Part Invoice Management - Day 1
Description:
906 - Part Invoice Flag on Account:
The system shall store the part invoice flag at the account level, indicating the customer’s ability to part invoice, and automatically flow this information to the quote based on the flag

Title: Bid Management & Process Automation Day 1
Description:
927 - Account summary for Bids team:
When Bids Service Request or Big Deal Review is raised, the system shall have the ability to provide a summary of conversation between sales users and customer and previous account activates to the bids team and commercials team respectively.
